neighborhood_overview: East Boston Originally a center of shipbuilding, East Boston has always been a neighborhood of immigrants. Today its population is made up largely of Italian-Americans and immigrants from Central and South America and Southeast Asia. That diversity is reflected in the neighborhood's myriad of ethnic restaurants. The nation's first branch library was built in East Boston in 1870. The housing is a mixture of old and new, including many restored triple-deckers.  Logan Airport, is located here, making East Boston a gateway to people from around the world. Located across Boston Harbor, East Boston residents enjoy fantastic waterfront views of the city skyline. From here you can easily get to downtown by taking blue line(two stops), and airport(one stop).
notes: The latest check in time is 10:30pm because it is hard to get the keys by yourself. We have this policy for the best customer service.
transit: The closest grocery store is only one min walk across the street. There are also a number of different shops, banks, bars, and restaurants nearby at Maverick. Please let us know if you are searching for a specific type of store or restaurant, and we can point you in the right direction! Blue line is three-min walk from the house at Maverick, as well as other buses.
access: If I am at home I will open the door for you. If I am not I will send you the check in tips to make sure you can get in. This information is discussed during the confirming of your stay and is based on arrive time. In the case you will get the keys by yourself, we have a video showing you exactly how to do it, please make sure watch it before your arrival. We would assume guests send a request are aware of this and please don't give us low rating on arrival for getting keys. Thank you very much.
interaction: I will be home in the night time. You can always send me message if you need anything.

We are at apt 2 and if you do need to ring the bell, please ring bell #2. Thank you! We don't want to border the neighbors. We appreciate your help.

neighborhood_overview: East Boston was once a center for shipbuilding, but it has always been a neighborhood of immigrants. You can see the diversity in the neighborhood’s many ethnic restaurants. East Boston is home to the nation’s first branch library, built in 1870. You’ll also find Logan Airport here. Neighborhood homes mix the old with the new, and include many restored triple-deckers. Residents enjoy waterfront views of the City skyline from across Boston Harbor. They also now have access to the beach by way of a brand new and beautiful greenway.
notes: The entrance for this basement unit is at the left side of the building. It is walk-out basement that is above the ground with regular window and door. The unit also has deck.
transit: It is very easy to get to airport or downtown Boston. You can take Blue Line subway, or 459 bus. Walk distance to constitution beach, any lots of restaurants. Easy access to all of Bostons great sites,  by the T to get access to the Aquarium, the financial district, TD Garden, Boston Common, the public gardens, all Museums, the Boston neighborhoods (Back Bay, Newbury, Copley) and much more.

house_rules: House Rules Parties are NOT permitted at this property. Guests caught having parties will be removed from the premises immediately and may be subject to an extra cleaning fee, and will not be refunded. Locals MUST communicate with us prior to booking. Having some family in town and need extra space? That’s perfectly fine, we just need to know the situation prior to booking. It helps us cut down on unauthorized activities in our properties. All of our properties have strict occupancy limits, imposed by city codes. That means that no more than the specified number of guests in your reservation are allowed in the property at any given time. The number of guests indicated in your reservation should be accurate. Children and infants do count towards this total. Please notify us of any changes to the guest count prior to your stay. Should we find that you have violated this rule, you will be removed from the property and will not receive a refund. This is a SELF CHECK IN property. By reservi
host_about:
My name is Shawn and I've enjoyed hosting guests from all over the world since 2012. I'm a news junkie, foodie and love reading. I was born and raised in Orlando, but moved to Boston 6 years ago. I absolutely love Boston and all it has to offer. From the culture, great culinary treats, to the many open spaces and historic sites. My second home is Fort Lauderdale and Vieques, PR. Can you say warm weather! 

I spend most of my day responding and answering guest inquiries and insuring guests have a pleasant stay. Does your Airbnb take up too much of your time? Want to put it on autopilot? Shoot me a message, I would love to help :)

Feel free to reach out with any questions. I try to respond as quickly as time allows and am always available for my guests! 

Happy Booking!

neighborhood_overview: Jeffries Point is one of Boston’s best-kept secrets, with spectacular views of the Boston Skyline, tons of green space, convenient public transportation and authentic restaurants and food options.  The neighborhood is quiet and friendly, with dog parks, basketball courts, and community gardens providing opportunities to relax outside. There are restaurants, bakeries and coffee shops.
notes: Top floor apartment with no elevator access. Noteworthy if you are traveling with heavy luggage!

host_about:
Architect, builder & idealist!
I love to think about my living space outside the box, so sharing and opening my door to AirBNB guests only makes sense. 
I am an outdoor enthusiast and love going hiking all seasons. You may also find me relaxing at home with a good book, planning an off the beaten path trip or getting ready for some local outdoor adventure. 
"Keep it simple" and "Less is More" are my inspiring mottos.

summary: My unit is in the historic Eagle Hill area of East Boston which is located close to the airport and only a few subway stops to downtown.  Everything is no more than a 10 min walk away!  From my door step to downtown Boston (Back Bay) is 20-25 mins via walking & subway!
space: Recently renovated, unit boasts granite counters, stainless steel appliances, tiled/laminate flooring and a renovated bathroom.  Five large windows bring in tons of daylight.  It may only be 500 sqft but it's enough space for a single, couple or small family.  Complete with dishes, silverware, pots and pans, microwave, stove (with oven) & electric kettle.  Towels & toiletries will be provided.  Coffee, tea, juice & water is also complimentary.

neighborhood_overview: Only a 10 min walk from the condo to the subway station, you'll pass many Hispanic and Italian restaurants with great food.  In a 5 min walk you'll find a grocery store, coffee shops, bank etc.  East Boston's waterfront has the best views of the city in the day and night!  My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers and small families.
notes: NA
transit: PARKING-Parking is street parking with a resident permit or 2 hrs free parking right out front.  Sundays are free or you can park at East Boston High School from 3pm-6am weekdays, or Saturday/Sunday. It's only a 8 min cab/uber ride from the airport (you can't get any closer!) or you can take the free shuttle to the Blue Line T stop and then walk.  East Boston is accessible to downtown Boston on the Blue Line which is only 1 stop to get to the Financial, North End or Fanueil Hall area.   If you don't want to walk the 10 mins to the subway station, there is a bus stop a few doors down.
access: Whole condo will be available for you.
interaction: I will be reachable by phone or email.  There may be a delay due to time change or wifi access if I'm out of the country.  I respect your privacy so we will not meet unless there is an issue.  The key will be in a lock box so check in/check out will never be a problem.
house_rules: ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING PLEASE. OWNER IS ALLERGIC AND SMOKE ALARM IS VERY SENSITIVE.   FIRE DEPARTMENT WILL BE NOTIFIED IF ALARM IS TRIGGERED.  (this also includes cooking at high heat I've found out!)  This is my home so please respect the rules.  Must be at least 21 to reserve.  Only confirmed occupants are allowed in the unit, no outside guests. Drawers/cabinets that are taped off and have been opened, forfeits the security deposit.
host_about:
I'm originally from Toronto but left in 2004 to live in the Cayman Islands, Greece, UK and now Boston.  I like to travel!
I work in Real Estate for a great office downtown.  I have lived in Boston for 8 years, 2 years of that have been in East Boston and I love it.
I use Airbnb myself as I like the conveniences of home.  I prefer to have a kitchen to make a quick breakfast, so I can get out and explore.  There is a whole world out there, you just need to get out and see it!

summary: Welcome to our brand new home, redesigned to be luxurious, clean and comfortable. Our guest room is the perfect sanctuary to relax and rest on your journey. You and a guest will enjoy a memory foam-topped mattress and your own bathroom located next to your bedroom. - Walk 8 mins to/from the airport - Walk 5 mins to the T (train). We're only one stop from downtown Boston! - Roku TV in your bedroom - Checking in/out is simple with our keyless entry - We accommodate early and late flights
space: You will be occupying our guest bedroom with private use of our newly renovated bathroom adjacent to your room. Our bathroom is outfitted with a glass shower, guest-use shampoo and conditioner, and a low-flow toilet.  The guest bed is a new full-sized mattress outfitted with a memory foam top and a down comforter. We have room-darkening curtains, and we provide complimentary eye masks (simply discard in the laundry when you're checking out). We also provide ear plugs for light sleepers. If this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive **$40 off** your stay: https://www.airbnb.com/c/tamour If this room is unavailable, feel free to inquire about one of our other rooms in the house. notes: We are opening our home to YOU! If you are friendly, kind, straightforward, and down-to-earth, we are the perfect hosts for you! Bonus points if you make us laugh.  Please *ask* for what you need during your stay!
transit: Walk from the airport or take a $6 uber. No need to rent a car - we are 4 blocks from the public transit train that will take you downtown and connect you to the greater Boston area.
access: We have a private deck with table and chairs as well as a lounging area in our backyard for your use during your stay.
interaction: We ALWAYS strive to have happy guests, so message us with whatever you need during your stay!
house_rules: - To keep cleaning costs low for our guests, we provide clean sheets for you to make your bed upon arrival. - No use of hair dye products anywhere in the home  - Remove shoes before entering - Lock windows and doors before leaving - Never any unplanned guests - Keep music quiet for other guests or hosts - NEVER anything but toilet paper in the toilets - use of washer/dryer not available unless staying for more than 7 nights or discussed with hosts.
host_about: We're Airbnb hosts that love to travel. Between the two of us, we've been to over 50 countries, including working in Australia, Mexico, and West Africa (where Andrea did the Peace Corps). We're both clean, courteous, friendly, and fun - we look forward to meeting you!

name: MiniStudio w/Parking Close to Dwntn
summary: Your own private entrance/entry. (First floor studio) Reserved Private parking spot adjacent to the building.  Private shower/bathroom. Air conditioning/heating unit  Mini fridge  No kitchen.  4 minute walk to the airport shuttle/train. 40 inch HDTV. High speed Wifi (75 MBps) and all sports and starter package channels. Netflix account as well. Queen sized bed
space: Small work place area, ideal for someone here for business or who wants to park their car here and save the hassle of finding reliable parking down town.  The train stop located two blocks away, is near the center of the MBTA train map. Connections to the Orange line/Green line/red line are all within 4 quick stops or less.  The Historic North End is located 2 stops away as well as the Aquarium, and various wharf side restaurants.   Three stops away is State Street, which connects you to the Red and Orange line, where you'll also find many food options as well as shopping stores.  Government center is the fourth stop which connects you to the Green line. There you will find Faneuil hall where there are famous trails and live entertainers during the week.

neighborhood_overview: There are many good restaurants or quick bites nearby. Roy's deli is a block over on Marion street and is a must visit. Jalisco's has won best tacos in Boston and they continue excelling with their Mexican food. You also have Lolly's bakery across the street where you ll find a large variety of sweets as well as coffee or cake.  There is a smaller supermarket directly across the street from the studio. There is also a good barber shop located two doors over. Salons located along Bennington street. A Walgreens and a CVS located 2-3 blocks in the same direction off Bennington street.  There is a running path to Piers park which provides a great view of the Boston sky line and large public space to hang out in the grass or picnic tables.
notes: I'm here to ensure we can assist you with anything or information you might need during your stay.
transit: Blue line airport train station is 3 blocks away, 4 minute walking distance.  There is a 120 bus (to Maverick on the opposite side of the street, or to Orient Heights that stops 10 feet from the front door. These buses will take you to each end of east Boston where you'll be closer to the water. (Piers park near Maverick/Constitution beach near Orient Heights) The Blue line train also goes to revere beach if you go on the side that says Wonderland. A weekly unlimited MBTA pass is $21.25. This allows unlimited bus, train and ferry use.  The toll to drive into the city is $3.50. Parking can be a pain/expensive if you're looking for something all day, we recommend you leave your vehicle here to enjoy the city without the hefty parking fines.
access: Shower, a full size(one size below a queen) bed, bureau to store clothes. Studio does not include a kitchen.  Guest will be provided with two large towels and two smaller sized towels.  Parking spot available in parking lot next door for use during your stay. There is a Laundromat located at the next corner, approximately 500 feet from this location.
interaction: This private studio is for one to two guests and has its own private entrance and doorway. Therefore, we usually won't see each other after the initial greet unless there is an issue or during an extended stay, the exchange of towels.  I live nearby and always carry my phone which means I'll respond quickly.
house_rules: Our only expectation is that you don't throw parties or leave a stack of trash laying against the wall.
host_about: I’ve lived in this area for 18 years. Originally from California. I’m a big time foodie and can make plenty of recommendations based on what you’re looking for. Boston is a big melting pot full of great restaurants and hidden games.

name: Cozy private room conveniently located
summary: My place is a residential ethnic & happy neighborhood, close to Maverick Station T stop(five minutes walk), the Airport, and downtown. We are located one stop from the airport, two stops from downtown Boston, & walking distance from the picturesque pier and jetty. There is also a bus stop right outside the front door, mini market across the street, 10 min walk from supermarket, banks, and restaurants nearby. We do not serve breakfast but a comfortable night sleep and a quieter place to stay!
space: We are always improving and we aim to give every guest a five star stay!  We do not serve breakfast (we would love to recommend our favorite places to eat), but a comfortable place to rest your head and recharge! If you are cooking inclined please ask us before hand since the kitchen cooking space is tight quarters. We have a side table and a counter to eat at. We also recommend checking out all the great food Boston has to offer! We are both working professionals who are on the busier side, but we always make time to talk to our guests and answer any questions! We are a typically self check-in place and have instructions for self check-in with photos available on the app once you book. We usually work pretty late so we utilize self check-in for your convenience to check in any time after 3 pm. The only bathroom we do have is shared, but we do our best to accommodate our guests in every aspect possible! If you could please hang your towels on the back of your room door to dry we would

neighborhood_overview: We are in a lovely diverse residential neighborhood full of nice people and new restaurants springing up all over! Our favorite quick bite to eat is Brasil Brazil, everyone is friendly and the food is delicious! There are two new restaurants Reel House, right on the pier, and Cunard Tavern which has a roof deck and the bottom floor is great for a meal. We have two excellent Italian places close by, one from almost the inception of East Boston. We are in walking distance from some of the best Latin food in Boston and would love to give you tips.
notes: Please be respectful of our home and us. We are not a hotel and hope to give you an authentic Boston experience! :)  No visitors allowed unless previously checked with the host. We are normally very flexible but have had unpleasant experiences so we appreciate if you ask. Please refrain from eating in your bedroom so we can keep bugs away and a tidy apartment for every guest.  Please remove your shoes :) We are flexible with check in time as long as it is after 3, we do self check-in typically so it's very flexible! We are on the second floor so there are stairs.  We just adopted a 20 pound senior corgi mix with almost no teeth, he's sweet and loving, and will never be allowed in your room.
transit: From the airport we suggest either Lyft, Uber, or the T (cabbies are overpriced and surly). To downtown we recommend the T as Boston can be quite trafficky and our T line is underground therefore usually the quickest.
access: NA
interaction: NA
house_rules: - Be respectful, we are opening our home to you. - Please no shoes in the house :) - Please lock the apartment door behind you it doesn't lock automatically, the front door does lock automatically. Lock the apartment door! - Clean up after yourself. - Please squeegee the shower door to prevent water damage on the floor  - Be mindful of the neighbors and our busy work schedule. - If you have any questions, please ask, we are very friendly people. Orwells baby gate should remain closed. He stays in the living room side during the day so he can’t cause any mischief in the kitchen or dart away when you enter the house. Please leave the baby gate closed when you leave if we’re not home. Please also lock the apartment door behind you.  - Enjoy your stay!
host_about: I am a young worker professional in Boston, I am clean and organized, fun, but I like my privacy. Love reading, watching tv series, listening to music, traveling, and cooking. I am pretty low key, quite, I like to be respected so I respect others.   I live to learn, travel, and have fun, all in good balance.

neighborhood_overview: East Boston Originally a center of shipbuilding, East Boston has always been a neighborhood of immigrants. Today its population is made up largely of Italian-Americans and immigrants from Central and South America and Southeast Asia. That diversity is reflected in the neighborhood's myriad of ethnic restaurants. The nation's first branch library was built in East Boston in 1870. The housing is a mixture of old and new, including many restored triple-deckers.  Logan Airport, is located here, making East Boston a gateway to people from around the world. Located across Boston Harbor, East Boston residents enjoy fantastic waterfront views of the city skyline. From here you can easily get to downtown by taking blue line(two stops), and airport(one stop).
notes: NA
transit: The closest grocery store is only one min walk across the street. There are also a number of different shops, banks, bars, and restaurants nearby at Maverick. Please let us know if you are searching for a specific type of store or restaurant, and we can point you in the right direction! Blue line is two-min walk from the house at Maverick, as well as other buses.
access: If I am at home I will open the door for you. If I am not I will send you the check in tips to make sure you can get in. This information is discussed during the confirming of your stay and is based on arrive time. In the case you will get the keys by yourself, we have a video showing you exactly how to do it, please make sure watch it before your arrival. We would assume guests send a request are aware of this and please don't give us low rating on arrival for getting keys. Thank you very much.
interaction: I will be home in the night time. You can always send me message if you need anything.
house_rules: Please read the check in instruction CAREFULLY and let me know if you have any question in advance.  We are at apt 2 and if you do need to ring the bell, please ring bell #2. Thank you! We don't want to border the neighbors. We appreciate your help.
host_about: I love running and always hit the road. I love meeting new friends. Not a big fun of cooking but a huge fun of Spanish and Chinese cuisine!

summary: IDEAL location and VIEW!! on the Mystic River with direct water/bridge view from bedroom and living room! Close to Logan Airport, public transport, downtown, parks, restaurants, cafes, grocery stores, gas station, etc. You’ll love the atmosphere, the view, the location, and the people. space: Chill atmosphere, lots of light and windows, open space, on the water. My Urban Temple :)

Close to Logan Airport, public transport, downtown, parks, restaurants, cafes, grocery stores, gas station, etc. You’ll love the atmosphere, the view, the location, and the people. My place is great for couples, friends, solo adventurers, and business travelers/layovers. Chill atmosphere, lots of light and windows, open space, on the water. My Urban Temple :) Bed, Shared Bath, Kitchen, Living Room, all accessible, private park bench seating area outside to enjoy view and fresh air. neighborhood_overview: Easy accessible neighborhood off the main street. Sometimes you can hear cars on the street. Private Condo Complex, building approx 10 years old, central to most traveling and transportation necessities, Shaw's Grocery Store, CVS Pharmacy (24 hours) Some of the BEST Italian and Mexican food in Boston!  Best View of Boston:  LoPresti Park on Sumner St(15 min walk)  Piers Park on Orleans St. (20 min walk) Best Restaurants: Mexican: Angela's Cafe on Lexington St. La Hacienda on Meridian St.  Italian: Rino's Place on Saratoga St.  D'Parma on Sumner St. Jeveli's on Saratoga St. Bar: Maverick Marketplace Cafe on Maverick St.  Kelley Square Pub Pizza: Santarpios on Chelsea St  Dough on Border St.  Vegetarian: La Sanghita Cafe on Maverick St. Unique: KO Pies on Marginal St.
notes: Sometimes there are social events taking place (friends visiting/wine tastings/music) but events never run too late or too loud.
transit: 7-10 minute driving distance from the airport, and to downtown. Bus stop across the street at the Mobile Gas Station: 3 min to Maverick Station to catch the blue line subway (one stop from aquarium or airport station.)  Walking to Maverick Station via Meridian St. is approx 15 min. PARKING***East Boston just re-zoned all the streets so there is 2-hour parking on my street right in front of condo and unlimited parking halfway down Condor St anywhere that doesn't have 2 hour parking signs, please take note of street cleaning times (on signs) to avoid getting a ticketed and towed.
access: Bed, Shared Bath, Kitchen, Living Room, all accessible, private park bench seating area outside to enjoy view and fresh air.

host_about: I love music, it is all around me. My condo space is a temple for serenity and music. I have instruments everywhere! Drums especially. I practice meditation, music, literature, and enjoy social events. I occasionally conduct artisan gatherings like wine tasting events or an acoustic jam. I am always meeting new people from around the world. I love different cultures and learning about them. I am a relaxed host. All life forms are welcome.

summary: My place is close to the Blue line Airport T station, only two stops from downtown Boston. In the immediate neighborhood you will find Shaw’s Supermarket, Rinos, Angela's, Oliveira's Restaurant, Roy's Cold Cuts. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and furry friends (pets). Bremen Street Park with it's playground and lawn areas is located directly behind the building and a great place for kids or for a walk with your dog.
space: The entire condo and back porch are exclusive to you as my guests. The condo is on two levels, level 1 has 2 Bedroom, 1 Bath and the basement level has another large bedroom with another bathroom.

house_rules: We ask that you would treat our home as you would yours. There is absolutely no smoking in the apartment.  If you smoke, you can do so on the back porch. Quiet time after 10pm. We DO NOT allow parties. Pets are allowed on a case by case basis for an addition $15 per night.  Please contact us if you will be bringing a pet.
host_about:
My broad background and entrepreneurial mindset has led me through a few different life opportunities.  I grew up in New York City in a wonderful family oriented community.  I then attended University in Arizona where I obtained an Industrial Engineering degree. I worked for Philips Semiconductors as an engineer in Arizona for 10 years where I also owned and managed my own rental properties. I was then offered to live and work in Europe as an engineer, which I really enjoyed for 3 years. Since settling in the Boston area I have been purchasing homes, renovating them and converting them into condos. 

I have a passion for both children and animals and my husband and I have spent many years as foster parents in Cambridge for the State of Massachusetts.  I am currently training my 8 year old yellow lab Sadie to work with a pet program that visits elders and adults with disabilities in local hospitals in and around Boston.

I enjoy sailing, traveling, reading and of course spending time with my husband and my labrador Sadie.

neighborhood_overview: The vibrant neighborhood features restaurants, shops, and one of the most beautiful waterfronts in the City.  East Boston was once a center for shipbuilding, but it has always been a neighborhood of immigrants. You can see the diversity in the neighborhood’s many ethnic restaurants. East Boston is home to the nation’s first branch library, built in 1870. You’ll also find Logan Airport here. Neighborhood homes mix the old with the new, and include many restored triple-deckers. Residents enjoy waterfront views of the City skyline from across Boston Harbor. They also now have access to the beach by way of a brand new and beautiful greenway.
notes: Self check-in (I will send you the codes the day of your booking if I'm not around to greet you) Street parking at night (6pm - 8am) 2 hour street parking during the day Paid parking space available 2 blocks away ($12/day)
transit: Blue Line (Maverick T stop 4 min walk) Airport (Airport shuttle 10 min walk) Car rental facility 15 min walk Watertaxi 2 hour street parking  8am to 6 pm $10/day parking lot a couple blocks away
access: You'll have access to the whole apartment  (living room with kitchen area, bedroom, bathroom)
interaction: I live in the same building so I'll be available if you need anything. Just text me!

There are Walgreens and CV'S pharmacies, Shaws Supermarket, Italian and Latin restaurants / bars (Maverick Market Place, Reelhouse, Café Gigu, KO Pies at the Shipyard, El Rincon Limeno, Angela's Cafe) and beautiful parks around it (Piers Park, Bremen Park)

name: Fully Renovated 1 bedroom near Airport
summary: Beautifully renovated one bedroom condo with your own private outdoor space. Bright, open, and comfortable. Pullout couch is also available in addition to the bedroom (queen bed). Short walk to the T Station which is less than a 10 minute ride to Faneuil Hall, the North End and all of downtown Boston. Less than 2 miles from Logan Airport. Walking distance to several restaurants/bars and located just minutes from the highway. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: Fully renovated space in 2016 with all brand new appliances, floors, walls, windows etc. High ceilings with built in skylights and a bay window give off a very open feel. Ample room for multiple guests to enjoy. The outdoor deck is available in warmer months and has a grill that guests may use.

name: Comfortable, convenient apartment in East Boston
summary: A bedroom (walk-thru) and a living room with a roll out queen bed is comfortable for a total of 3 people. Our place is good for families, friends, couples, and business travelers.
space: The apartment  has three rooms (living room, pass-through bedroom, and an eat-in kitchen) plus a large, very roomy bathroom.  The queen size sofabed in the  living room is a rollout (more comfortable than traditional sofa foldout bed).  There is a lot of pleasant soft light throughout the apartment. The apartment is on the second floor and there is access to the backyard from the rear door of the apartment. In warm weather one can sit outside and use the internet, read, or have a meal.

Airbnb is great because you get to meet people you wouldn't necessarily have a chance to meet or see interesting areas of a city you wouldn’t have planned to see !

name: Family Home | Amazing Views of Harbor & Downtown!
summary: Come enjoy our family-friendly home featuring incredible views of Boston Harbor & Downtown. Located in a quiet, private setting in a lovely residential neighborhood with convenient access to Downtown Boston and the subway system.  Steps away from beautiful parks and the waterfront. Enjoy mesmerizing views from our roof deck! Our family is traveling for the summer and we are very happy to extend our home to your family. We'll do everything we can to make sure your family has a wonderful stay!
space: If you are a family looking for a comfortable, convenient place to stay in Boston, this is it! This is a fully furnished family home on a quiet residential street. The house is set back down a private alley. The building itself is a duplex—we have quiet, kind tenants who live in a separate top floor apartment. Our unit has a private entrance, a full kitchen, beautiful views of Boston Harbor, and tons of natural sunlight. We feel very grateful to live here and we are confident it will be a wonderful place for your family! Our fully furnished home features: * Gorgeous views of Boston harbor from living room, study, and roof deck * Two floors of living space with a full bathroom on each floor * Three bedrooms plus one office/study with a foldout couch * Lots of windows and natural sunlight! * Efficient galley-style kitchen with butcher-block counter tops and dishwasher * Large walk-in foyer with storage space for coats and shoes * TWO full bathrooms, one on each floor * Washer & Dryer ava
description: Come enjoy our family-friendly home featuring incredible views of Boston Harbor & Downtown. Located in a quiet, private setting in a lovely residential neighborhood with convenient access to Downtown Boston and the subway system.  Steps away from beautiful parks and the waterfront. Enjoy mesmerizing views from our roof deck! Our family is traveling for the summer and we are very happy to extend our home to your family. We'll do everything we can to make sure your family has a wonderful stay! If you are a family looking for a comfortable, convenient place to stay in Boston, this is it! This is a fully furnished family home on a quiet residential street. The house is set back down a private alley. The building itself is a duplex—we have quiet, kind tenants who live in a separate top floor apartment. Our unit has a private entrance, a full kitchen, beautiful views of Boston Harbor, and tons of natural sunlight. We feel very grateful to live here and we are confident it will be a wonderful
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in the Jeffries Point section of East Boston. It's a hidden gem.  Right by the water, close to the city, full of green spaces and parks, with delicious food, it is hard to beat!  We love our diverse community and the fact that you can meet people from all over the world on the harbor walk or at the park.
notes: NA
transit: SUBWAY Maverick T Station is a 10-minute walk from our home, and takes you into the heart of Boston in one stop. PARKING Admittedly, parking in the city can be tricky. There is overnight street parking one street over. Two-hour parking is allowed during weekdays. If you have questions, please contact us!
access: You'll have full access to our home.
interaction: We will be spending the summer in Europe visiting family, but our trusted friends and neighbors Rob and Juliet will be available via phone and text (and occasionally in person) to answer any questions. They'll be happy to share local tips and recommendations with you!
house_rules: Sorry, absolutely NO PARTIES! Because this is a family home in a residential neighborhood, we must strictly require that there is no excessive drinking, loud music, partying, or any behavior that could disturb our neighbors. We have a zero tolerance policy on this matter. So if you're looking for a party spot, please look elsewhere! Additionally, we hope you use—and LOVE—our roof deck. You are responsible for your own safety while using the stairs and roof deck.
host_about: My husband Trent and I have lived in this lovely spot in East Boston for the last 9 years, and we are so grateful for the community and resources around us.  We have three young children (9, 8 and 4) and love for our home to be a special place for others while we travel to be with family.  I am a birth doula and childbirth educator, I love to read at least 5 books at a time,  I have a weakness for musical theater, and Izmir, Turkey, where I grew up, will always hold a special place in my heart.

name: All New Renovation, Just for YOU - private room #1
summary: Apartment is a 5-8min. walking distance to the Airport Station as well as Maverick Station, both leading into Downtown Boston in just 10min.! My apartment is 100% renovated with all bran new supplies & furniture, including a comfy elite therapedic bed. It's a safe & quite neighborhood, walking distance to large parks, library, and tons of restaurants, cafes & bars. 2 beaches at 10min. for summer. Our apt. is perfect for couple getaways, solo adventures, business travelers, & family event travels
space: The apartment is 100% renovated and 100% newly furnished (beds, desks, couches, table, kitchen supply, decor) as of December 2016. Super clean and organized. It is a cozy home on the second floor with 9 windows allowing beautiful natural lighting. I provide excellent communication at all times before and during your stay.
description: Apartment is a 5-8min. walking distance to the Airport Station as well as Maverick Station, both leading into Downtown Boston in just 10min.! My apartment is 100% renovated with all bran new supplies & furniture, including a comfy elite therapedic bed. It's a safe & quite neighborhood, walking distance to large parks, library, and tons of restaurants, cafes & bars. 2 beaches at 10min. for summer. Super clean and organized. It is a cozy home on the second floor with 9 windows allowing beautiful natural lighting. I provide excellent communication at all times before and during your stay. The bedroom you book is private for you, with lock (you will be provided a key). Common area accessible to you is the bathroom, living room and kitchen. *IMPORTANT to know/con
neighborhood_overview: Apartment is across the street from a school so it is a super friendly area and safe streets. Busy hours would only be 7-8am and 2-4pm on school days, otherwise it is a very quite and peaceful neighborhood.
notes: EXPLORE BOSTON! I provide you with pamphlets of things to do in Boston along with a map of the MBTA to get around AND a free charlie card bus/train pass so you don't have to hunt for it at the stations! --------- As for parking, there is free street parking. The only hassle to note is that Boston has a 2 hour parking limit for street parking and then it is resident parking overnight after 6pm. However, 3 blocks away, there is a very cheap parking lot that is directly in front of one of the train stations near us.  The address is 12 Maverick Sq. Boston, MA 02128 The price is: $10 for the day time 6am-6pm and $10 for overnight 6pm to 6am (*Although ticketing in our area is not aggressive, leaving your vehicle parked on the street all day and/or night will be at your own risk for a ticket from the Boston Transportation Department.*)
transit: As mentioned, you will be minutes from 2 major train station (Maverick and Airport). There are tons of restaurants, cafes and bars at walking distance or just hop on the train for a 10 minute drive to Downtown Boston! There is also the YMCA and a HUGE beautiful park for walking, jogging, reading, etc. A new public library and 2 nearby beaches, also train accessible and 10 minute ride!
access: The bedroom you book is private for you, with lock (you will be provided a key). Common area accessible to you is the bathroom, living room and kitchen.
interaction: *IMPORTANT to know/consider before booking* This is a 2 bedroom apartment in which we do not live in. It is a separate property that my sister and I have and host together for airbnb only; both bedrooms are rented separately as a private room for airbnb guests. Therefore, you may be sharing the home with 1-2 other airbnb guest(s) if the other room is also booked during your stay.  *ADDITIONAL NOTE*  Both my sister and I only live 8-10 minutes away from apartment. We are extremely attentive to all our guests and continuously communicate with most of our guests (those who need it) during their stay as a resource for their exploration of the city life. We are reachable via phone text message, airbnb chat, email, phone call, and of course, in person as well, as needed. We've made great connections with many guests and love the mutual balance of providing our guests with their privacy and space as their own home away from home, while still being extra attentive, responsive and communicative
house_rules: - Quiet Hours after 10:00pm. - Additional guests $35/night  (no more than 1 extra guest, non-negotiable). - Clean up after self in Kitchen and Living room. - Leave keys in bedroom and please close & lock apt. door behind you.  * You may message me for possible accommodations with check-in/check-out.* * Extra fees will take place if keys are lost and/or items/furniture have been damaged* * NO THIRD  PARTY BOOKING* Only people confirmed on the reservation will be accepted to stay.
host_about: Young Latina woman with a social work bachelors and personal training certification. Love the city, exploring, getting lost in random adventures, traveling, and learning! Super passionate about what we do and always working hard toward the next best thing.

name: One bedroom apartment near subway and airport
summary: Small one bedroom located a short distance from the airport shuttle, public transportation, and a number of restaurants and amenities. From the front door, one can be to Faneuil Hall in under 20 minutes by train, or 10 minutes by automobile. Short walk to Bremen Street park, and the East Boston Greenway, which connects to Piers Park, with its incredible harbor and city views.
space: A cozy city apartment, you will have access to one bedroom which contains a new memory foam mattress (overall it is a 2 bed, but I will be using my bedroom as storage while I am gone). This isn't a brand new luxury apartment, if that is what you require, but it is home. The back of the apartment faces east and gets plenty of natural light during the morning (when the sun is out), and the bedroom is at the back of the house so it limits the street noise one would typically hear.
description: Small one bedroom located a short distance from the airport shuttle, public transportation, and a number of restaurants and amenities. From the front door, one can be to Faneuil Hall in under 20 minutes by train, or 10 minutes by automobile. Short walk to Bremen Street park, and the East Boston Greenway, which connects to Piers Park, with its incredible harbor and city views. Covered in the "other things to note" section, while you will have access to the kitchen, please note that if you are cooking that running
neighborhood_overview: Boston's true melting pot neighborhood: once Boston's *other* Italian neighborhood, East Boston is home many people from around the world, and is slowly becoming the new spot for young professionals and families seeking more affordable homes within a stone's throw of downtown. Great food options from Italian, to Colombian, Mexican, Salvadoran, Peruvian, and Vietnamese, and much more.
notes: Please, please note that the electricity in the kitchen is a little tricky: please do not use more than one of the microwave, toaster, coffee maker, or convection cooker at a time. That circuit tends to trip if more than one of these is used at once, and this will cause the refrigerator and internet to go down, as they are on the same breaker. I cannot guarantee the situation can be fixed immediately if it were to happen as the breakers are in another unit in the building, not in common space.
transit: The subway, which is two stops to downtown, is located a 5 minute walk away. Also, Uber is typically no more than 5 minutes away at any given time.
access: Covered in the "other things to note" section, while you will have access to the kitchen, please note that if you are cooking that running multiple appliances can cause the breaker to trip and will cause the fridge and wifi to go offline. I mainly avoid having this happen, but please be aware.
interaction: I will be out of the country at the time. I can be reached via (Hidden by Airbnb) .
house_rules: - This is a third floor apartment with a family living below, so please try to keep shoes off inside, and limit noise from 11pm-7am. Be mindful in walking up the stairs during this time.
host_about: I am from Boston, MA. I love traveling, cuisine, and discovering new places.

name: Boston Harbor-Waterfront- Master Bed-Attached Bath
summary: Calm Beautiful Waterfront Apartment and 9-mins from Downtown Boston and Revere beach You’ll love my place because of incredible water and majestic downtown views, and its location (sea, shopping district, restaurants and public transportation is just a stone's throw from apt). Refreshing Piers Park and 3.3 miles walking/jogging Greenway path are in the neighborhood  My place is good for anyone who is a tourist or visiting Boston for work. Welcome!!
space: SLEEPING ARRANGEMENTS: Master Bedroom with spectacular water and downtown view. West facing and hence direct sunlight from 1 pm onwards. The room has 1 queen bed that sleeps 2 people. For guests more than 2, there is a queen size and twin size air mattress. There is also a huge leather sofa (not sofa bed) in the living room that many guests preferred to sleep on (actually, they loved it). Plenty of blankets and pillows available. For guests more than 3, an extra-shared bath will be made available.  SHOPPING FACILITIES (all downstairs): Shaws (grocery supermarket), Marshalls (super department store), Kappys (wine & spirits chain), Expressions (Fashion outlet), RadioShack, ZipCar, 24 Hour CVS Pharmacy, 24 Hour Walgreens Pharmacy, 24 Hour McDonalds’, Dunkin Donuts, Subway, T-Mobile and plenty of speciality grocery stores.  RESTAURANTS (within 5-8 mins walking distance): Saigon Hut (Vietnamese), Harbor Pacific (Chinese), Santarpio's (Italian), Mi Rancho (Colombian), Rosticeria Cancun (Mexi
description: Calm Beautiful Waterfront Apartment and 9-mins from Downtown Boston and Revere beach You’ll love my place because of incredible water and majestic downtown views, and its location (sea, shopping district, restaurants and public transportation is just a stone's throw from apt). Refreshing Piers Park and 3.3 miles walking/jogging Greenway path are in the neighborhood  My place is good for anyone who is a tourist or visiting Boston for work. Welcome!! SLEEPING ARRANGEMENTS: Master Bedroom with spectacular water and downtown view. West facing and hence direct sunlight from 1 pm onwards. The room has 1 queen bed that sleeps 2 people. For guests more than 2, there is a queen size and twin size air mattress. There is also a huge leather sofa (not sofa bed) in the living room that many guests preferred to sleep on (actually, they loved it). Plenty of blankets and pillows available. For guests more than 3, an extra-shared bath will be made available.  SHOPPING FACILITIES (all downstairs): Shaws
neighborhood_overview: East Boston is a small neighborhood focused around its Train Station. You'll find the Boston Public Library and YMCA just 1 minute walking from the apt. There are Walgreens and CV'S pharmacies, Shaws Supermarket, Italian and Latin restaurants / bars (Maverick Market Place, Café Gigu, KO Pies at the Shipyard, El Rincon Limeno, Angela's Cafe) and beautiful parks around it (Piers Park, Bremen Park)

name: Private room near Airport and Downtown
summary: A simple, clean, room, for a single person or couple spending time in the Boston area. This is a warm and welcoming family home, a short walking distance from the subway, and Logan airport. It's one block from Piers Park, with beautiful views of downtown Boston. The neighborhood has an eclectic mix of local restaurants, and some fun night spots too. You can take the subway downtown within minutes, and return home to the peaceful Jeffries Point area of East Boston.
space: Our house, built in 1849, was one of the first houses in East Boston. It is not fancy, but is a humble, sunny, cheerful, single family home, with a porch and a small back yard. The bedroom is clean and simple, and we hope you find it comfortable.
description: A simple, clean, room, for a single person or couple spending time in the Boston area. It is not fancy, but is a humble, sunny, cheerful, single family home, with a porch and a small back yard. The bedroom is clean and simple, and we hope you find it comfortable. You will have keys to the house, and will stay in a private bedroom on the second floor. The bathroom on that floor is shared with our house mate and other guests. We are flexible and are happy to answer any questions you may have. We hope to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
neighborhood_overview: East Boston is a wonderful and unique neighborhood of Boston. We have lived and worked here for 25 years, and think it's the best part of the City!
notes: We have a lovely cat named Petunia, and hope you enjoy snuggling with her.
transit: Our house is a five minute walk from the subway, and 10 minutes from downtown Boston or Logan airport. There are beautiful places to visit, both North, East, and South of the City - consider taking a boat ride to explore the Boston Harbor Islands.  In the warmer months, there are several HubWay bike rental stations near by, and a wonderful park system that is worth exploring. Take a bike ride to Constitution Beach, or check out a free concert in Piers Park.    Street parking is usually pretty easy to find, but pay close attention to street sweeping signs, as Boston is notorious for towing.
access: You will have keys to the house, and will stay in a private bedroom on the second floor. The bathroom on that floor is shared with our house mate and other guests.
interaction: We are flexible and are happy to answer any questions you may have. We hope to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
house_rules: - Be friendly to Petunia, our beautiful cat. - Quiet hours between 10pm-7am. - Say hello to other house mates.
host_about:
My name is Madeleine. I am the Co-Founder and Executive Director of a nationally recognized creative youth development organization called ZUMIX. I have lived and worked in East Boston for 27 years.

My husband’s name is Pedro. He is an academic and business man who is also deeply involved with the community. 

We have 3 cats, a small bird, and a wonderful dog. 

We love this neighborhood, truly enjoy hosting Airbnb guests, and hope everyone enjoys their time in Boston.

name: Sunny Bedroom near Beach, Airport, & Downtown
summary: A private bedroom/shared bath in a recently restored single family home (c.1912) in the Harborview neighborhood of East Boston. Note: We also offer the entire house for groups of 3-8 staying for an entire weekend. Feel free to message us about that listing.
space: An Art Deco inspired guest bedroom with an antique brass bed for two, a large closet with built in dresser, and a shared bathroom with a blue clawfoot tub.
description: A private bedroom/shared bath in a recently restored single family home (c.1912) in the Harborview neighborhood of East Boston. Note: We also offer the entire house for groups of 3-8 staying for an entire weekend. Feel free to message us about that listing. An Art Deco inspired guest bedroom with an antique brass bed for two, a large closet with built in dresser, and a shared bathroom with a blue clawfoot tub. You are welcome to share use of the kitchen, dining room, livingroom, and yard. Please note that there is a TV, record player, computer, and fireplace on site that may be available to you with permission. Schedules permitting, we might be able to pick you up from the airport. 3 minute walk to the public beach, play ground, tennis courts, yacht club, skating rink, and bike path to Piers Park. 10 minute walk to the nearest train station & 1 stop away from the airport. notes: We have two big (but friendly!) dogs named Moose and Bear, and a kitten named Kangaroo. They are not allowed to enter your room, but they are allowed everywhere else, so if you would like to snuggle them, you'll have to do so in another room ;) Please do not book with us if you are afraid or allergic. We are close to the airport and train. We provide earplugs and a white noise machine for light sleepers, but the trains do stop running at 12:30  For more pictures of the house and renovation process, check out @mattyedew on Instagram.

name: ★ Sunny, Spacious & Modern ★ Great For Couples ★
summary: Welcome! If you are in Boston for a vacation, business or just a short layover, you've found the perfect place to call your base. • Modern, tastefully decorated, ultra-clean with a ton of sunlight. • Great for couples and solo travelers. • Nearby subway will take you into the heart of Boston in 1 stop! • Affordable, great price for central location! • All of the amenities provided, plus free drinks and snacks for all our guests. • Easy access to airport - catch that early flight!
space: Recently renovated, gorgeous modern apartment with ton of sunlight. This room is on the 1st floor. Please note that you're renting a single private bedroom within a larger apartment. There are several private bedrooms in the house - most of which are used by other Airbnb guests, so you'll be in good company. The living room provides a great place to relax after a day of exploring the area, connect with other guests that may be staying at the same time, or just read a book on a couch. Our kitchen is available to all of our guests with complimentary coffee, tea, other drinks and snacks.  Stock up in a supermarket next door and use the kitchen to prepare a breakfast or lunch before you head out the door. There are 2 bathrooms in the apartment - you can use either one, as you prefer. - Is this your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay: http://www.airbnb.com/c/bmordkovich - Is this room not available for the dates you want? Check out our other listings for oth

There are several private bedrooms in the house - most of which are used by other Airbnb guests, so you'll be in good company. Our kitchen is available t
neighborhood_overview: It's hard to find a better neighborhood in Boston. Check out what Airbnb says about East Boston here: https://www.airbnb.com/locations/boston/east-boston You are about a 9-10 minute walk from 2 subway stations. One is Maverick Station, which is just 1 stop away from Downtown Boston and the other is the Airport Station, where you can hop on a free shuttle to go to the airport. Lots of delicious, inexpensive places to eat in the neighborhood. Make sure to check out Monte Cristo restaurant a block away - it's huge portions of delicious Latin American food for just $10-15/entree.  If you want to get a coffee before you head out exploring, we have a small neighborhood coffee shop nearby (Americano Espresso Bar) which serves awesome lattes. Alternatively, Dunkin' Donuts is less than a block away. Plus, a full-size supermarket is just 4 blocks away. Stock up on groceries or your favorite foods for your stay! You can keep it in the fridge in the apartment, while you're staying with us. A short
notes: Flying into to Boston early in the morning or leaving late in the evening? As a courtesy, you can drop off your luggage in our common area before you check-in or leave it there until the evening after check-out. This way, you can enjoy the city without having to worry about luggage. Please note that it will be in the public view and we're not liable for it, however.
transit: It's easy! There are 2 subway stations nearby: Maverick and Airport. They are both about the same distance - 9-10 minute by walking. If you go to Maverick, hop on the Blue Line and take it one stop towards the Aquarium. Once you come out, you'll be right in the heart of Boston where you can easily explore by foot.  Alternatively, we highly recommend to use Uber. With Uber Pool, most rides to downtown Boston or Cambridge will be $4-5 and be very quick. You can also try out Boston's Bike Share network called Hubway. A day's pass is just $6 and gives you 24 hours of unlimited bike usage (in 30 minute segments).
access: Fast Wi-Fi available, so you can catch up with friends or on work at any time. A fully featured kitchen is available at your disposal. Great opportunity to relax, have a snack or meet other guests. Keurig K-Cup coffee machine with unlimited gourmet coffee. Complimentary tea selection is also available. Great way to start your morning! Access to the fridge, with free snacks and drinks provided. Private shelf space offered for each room. Two shared bathrooms are available in the apartment. Both feature a full size shower. Comfortable living room area with games and books for your enjoyment. Relax on the couch after a day of exploring the city. Everything is brand-new, modern and very comfortable.
interaction: Most of the times, you won't see us at the space due to other commitments. We offer self check-in and self check-out for your convenience.  However, we're both just a phone call away and are always happy to help, offer advice, or assist with whatever will make your stay more comfortable. Please don't hesitate to reach out at any time!
house_rules: 1. Check out is at 12pm.  2. Got an early or late flight? You can drop off your luggage before check in or store it for a few hours after check out in the common area! 3. Enjoy the free snacks and drinks in the kitchen.  4. If you store food in the fridge during your stay, please dispose of it before you leave. 5. If you use the dishes in the kitchen, please wash them after you use them. 6. Late arrivals are no problem. However, if you arrive after 9pm, please be respectful of noise level when you come in. Other guests will appreciate it. 7. No smoking anywhere in the house or on the deck. Please respect our neighbors as well.
host_about:
Hi there!

We are Boris and Susan - a young, professional couple living in Boston. 

I (Boris) is originally from Lithuania and Susan is from China - and we've been living in Boston for the last 6+ years.

I'm an entrepreneur and an avid traveler. My work focuses on startups and the transportation sector. In the past, I've been a part of the first person-to-person carsharing startup that helped people share their cars with neighbors (think Airbnb + Zipcar). After that, I have founded - and currently run - an electric bike company called EVELO that makes it easier for people to get around wherever they live. 

Susan works as a marketing professional at a larger company and is a huge photography buff. Many of the photos you'll see in our apartment are the ones done by her in our travels.

We both love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. Over the last few years, we've traveled together to Africa, Cuba, Iceland, Eastern and Western Europe, and Asia - as much as possible we love to incorporate travel in our lifestyle.

We wanted to share our apartment with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

And also, if this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: http://www.airbnb.com/c/bmordkovich

space: Recently renovated, gorgeous modern apartment with ton of sunlight. This room is on the 1st floor. Please note that you're renting a single private bedroom within a larger apartment. There are several private bedrooms in the house - most of which are used by other Airbnb guests, so you'll be in good company.  The living room provides a great place to relax after a day of exploring the area, connect with other guests that may be staying at the same time, or just read a book on a couch. Our kitchen is available to all of our guests with complimentary coffee, tea, other drinks and snacks. There are 2 bathrooms in the apartment - you can use either one, as you prefer. - Is this your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay: http://www.airbnb.com/c/bmordkovich - Is this room not available for the dates you want? Check out our other listings for ot
description: Welcome! If you are in Boston for a vacation, business or just a short layover, you've found the perfect place to call your base. • Modern, tastefully decorated, ultra-clean with a ton of sunlight. • Great for couples and solo travelers. • Nearby subway will take you into the heart of Boston in 1 stop! • Affordable, great price for central location! • All of the amenities provided, plus free drinks and snacks for all our guests. • Easy access to airport - catch that early flight! Recently renovated, gorgeous modern apartment with ton of sunlight. This room is on the 1st floor. Please note that you're renting a single private bedroom within a larger apartment. There are several private bedrooms in the house - most of which are used by other Airbnb guests, so you'll be in good company.  The living room provides a great place to relax after a day of exploring the area, connect with other guests that may be staying at the same time, or just read a book on a couch. Our kitchen is available
neighborhood_overview: It's hard to find a better neighborhood in Boston. Check out what Airbnb says about East Boston here: https://www.airbnb.com/locations/boston/east-boston You are about a 9-10 minute walk from 2 subway stations. One is Maverick Station, which is just 1 stop away from Downtown Boston and the other is the Airport Station, where you can hop on a free shuttle to go to the airport. Lots of delicious, inexpensive places to eat in the neighborhood. Make sure to check out Monte Cristo restaurant a block away - it's huge portions of delicious Latin American food for just $10-15/entree.  If you want to get a coffee before you head out exploring, we have a small neighborhood coffee shop nearby (Americano Espresso Bar) which serves awesome lattes. Alternatively, Dunkin' Donuts is less than a block away. Plus, a full-size supermarket is just 4 blocks away. Stock up on groceries or your favorite foods for your stay! You can keep it in the fridge in the apartment, while you're staying with us. A short
notes: Flying into to Boston early in the morning or leaving late in the evening? As a courtesy, you can drop off your luggage in our common area before you check-in or leave it there until the evening after check-out. This way, you can enjoy the city without having to worry about luggage. Please note that it will be in the public view and we're not liable for it, however.
transit: It's easy! There are 2 subway stations nearby: Maverick and Airport. They are both about the same distance - 9-10 minute by walking. If you go to Maverick, hop on the Blue Line and take it one stop towards the Aquarium. Once you come out, you'll be right in the heart of Boston where you can easily explore by foot.  Alternatively, we highly recommend to use Uber. With Uber Pool, most rides to downtown Boston or Cambridge will be $4-5 and be very quick. You can also try out Boston's Bike Share network called Hubway. A day's pass is just $6 and gives you 24 hours of unlimited bike usage (in 30 minute segments).
access: Fast Wi-Fi available, so you can catch up with friends or on work at any time. A fully featured kitchen is available at your disposal. Great opportunity to relax, have a snack or meet other guests. Keurig K-Cup coffee machine with unlimited gourmet coffee. Complimentary tea selection is also available. Great way to start your morning! Access to the fridge, with free snacks and drinks provided. Private shelf space offered for each room. Two shared bathrooms are available in the apartment. Both feature a full size shower. Comfortable living room area with games and books for your enjoyment. Relax on the couch after a day of exploring the city. Everything is brand-new, modern and very comfortable.
interaction: Most of the times, you won't see us at the space due to other commitments. We offer self check-in and self check-out for your convenience.  However, we're both just a phone call away and are always happy to help, offer advice, or assist with whatever will make your stay more comfortable. Please don't hesitate to reach out at any time!
house_rules: 1. Check out is at 12pm.  2. Got an early or late flight? You can drop off your luggage before check in or store it for a few hours after check out in the common area! 3. Enjoy the free snacks and drinks in the kitchen.  4. If you store food in the fridge during your stay, please dispose of it before you leave. 5. If you use the dishes in the kitchen, please wash them after you use them. 6. Late arrivals are no problem. However, if you arrive after 9pm, please be respectful of noise level when you come in. Other guests will appreciate it. 7. No smoking anywhere in the house or on the deck. Please respect our neighbors as well.
host_about:
Hi there!

We are Boris and Susan - a young, professional couple living in Boston. 

I (Boris) is originally from Lithuania and Susan is from China - and we've been living in Boston for the last 6+ years.

I'm an entrepreneur and an avid traveler. My work focuses on startups and the transportation sector. In the past, I've been a part of the first person-to-person carsharing startup that helped people share their cars with neighbors (think Airbnb + Zipcar). After that, I have founded - and currently run - an electric bike company called EVELO that makes it easier for people to get around wherever they live. 

Susan works as a marketing professional at a larger company and is a huge photography buff. Many of the photos you'll see in our apartment are the ones done by her in our travels.

We both love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. Over the last few years, we've traveled together to Africa, Cuba, Iceland, Eastern and Western Europe, and Asia - as much as possible we love to incorporate travel in our lifestyle.

We wanted to share our apartment with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

And also, if this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: http://www.airbnb.com/c/bmordkovich

name: Newly Renovated Harborside Charmer - Near Airport
summary: Spacious, private, newly renovated guest suite in Jeffries Point.  Enjoy Boston charm across the street from the harbor on a quiet, tree-lined street.  Sleeps 2 on twin beds.   Close to the airport and the T and one stop to Fanieul Hall, or take a sunset water taxi across the harbor!  Around the corner from great restaurants like: Italian Express, KO Pies, Santarpios, Downeast Cider and more.   Hosts Jess & JT live on the floor above and are available and accommodating to your needs.
space: Boston short term rental registration number:  400258 *Business Cert pending Our space is roughly 600 square feet and is fully private with an external entrance and a staircase + door which separates our unit from the Airbnb.  My husband and I own and live on the property.  A note on noise:  We live upstairs and you may hear us walking around, particularly in the morning on weekdays when we are getting ready for work.  We are mindful of noise, and then are usually not home during the day but are reachable through the app.  We have a small dog, Purdle the Pug.  He barks on occasion, but we've never had anyone complain.  It's city living, it's not always the quietest, though our street and neighborhood is FAR quieter than south end, back bay & beacon hill. Please know - you do not need to tiptoe around and be quiet on our account- we hope you enjoy music, the tv - it's your vacation!!
description: Spacious, private, newly renovated guest suite in Jeffries Point.  Enjoy Boston charm across the street from the harbor on a quiet, tree-lined street.  Sleeps 2 on twin beds.   Close to the airport and the T and one stop to Fanieul Hall, or take a sunset water taxi across the harbor!  Around the corner from great restaurants like: Italian Express, KO Pies, Santarpios, Downeast Cider and more.   Hosts Jess & JT live on the floor above and are available and accommodating to your needs. Boston short term rental registration number:  400258 *Business Cert pending Our space is roughly 600 square feet and is fully private with an external entrance and a staircase + door which separates our unit from the Airbnb.  My husband and I own and live on the property.  A note on noise:  We live upstairs and you may hear us walking around, particularly in the morning on weekdays when we are getting ready for work.  We are mindful of noise, and then are usually not home during the day but are reachable
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is residential and charming.  There are many renovated victorians and brick row-houses along our tree lined street.  Peek between the buildings for sweeping harbor views of Seaport and downtown.  There are several great local restaurants in the area - we've outlined our favorite spots in our guide book!
notes: PARKING There is free on-street parking in our neighborhood! You can park a car on Sumner Street (right around the corner from our the apartment) from 6pm - 8am on weekdays and all day/night on weekends.  It is 2 hour parking only from 8am - 6pm during the day on weekdays.  If you need to leave a car during the day on weekday visits you can put your car in a paid lot or garage nearby.
transit: We are a 10 minute walk from the Maverick T stop, which is 1 stop (3 min) from Aquarium (North End, Downtown Crossing, Fanieul Hall).  It's very easy to get around.  If you need any help getting around please message us and we're happy to get you oriented :)
access: Please be sure you enter through the BLACK door at street level.  (not the RED door) - this leads to our neighbors unit.  You will hear a doggie bark behind their door.
interaction: We are reachable through the app and can be available as needed, but also want to respect your privacy and your time.  Please let us know if there's anything at all you need.
house_rules: NA
host_about:
Hi! I’m Jess.  I'm an SC native and live in Boston with my husband and our pug, Purdle.  By day, I lead a sales team at a technology start up in downtown Boston. 
 My hobbies include interior design, yoga, reading, and traveling.  I love meeting people from all over the world through traveling and hosting on AirBnb.

Pretty close to Santarpio's Pizza, Dough East Boston. Easy access to public transportation! Explore the new casinos, by train 25 minutes away Encore Boston Harbor.

name: Entire Home Near Beach, Airport, & Downtown
summary: A recently restored single family home (c.1912) in the Harborview neighborhood of East Boston. It includes 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, kitchen, dining room, living room, and back yard.
space: A Bohemian master bedroom with a bed for two and a huge closet. An Art Deco inspired guest bedroom with an antique brass bed for two, with a closet and built in dresser. A shared bathroom with a blue clawfoot tub.
description: A recently restored single family home (c.1912) in the Harborview neighborhood of East Boston. It includes 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, kitchen, dining room, living room, and back yard. A Bohemian master bedroom with a bed for two and a huge closet. An Art Deco inspired guest bedroom with an antique brass bed for two, with a closet and built in dresser. A shared bathroom with a blue clawfoot tub. Guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, living room, bathroom, two bedrooms, and back yard. 3 minute walk to the public beach, play ground, tennis courts, yacht club, skating rink, and bike path to Piers Park. 10 minute walk to the nearest train station & 1 stop away from the airport. Nearby many restaurants, predominantly Italian and Latin American. Get to the heart of downtown Boston in under 10 minutes by car, 15 minutes by train, or 20 minutes by water taxi from Piers Park. name: Bright & Cozy 1 Bedroom, Close to Subway & Airport
summary: Welcome! This bright and cozy one bedroom apartment offers the comfort and accessibility of the city, but at a fraction of the cost of being downtown.  The apartment is a quiet and comfortable, with modern and in a safe neighborhood only 4 minutes walk the Airport T station and Airport shuttle.  Two stop from the North End/New England Aquarium and just three stops to Downtown Boston and Quincy Market.
space: The place is yours! Apartment and room come fully furnished (bed, linen, pillow, towels, and bathroom) with central heat, window mounted AC, Wifi, and streaming enabled (e.g. Netflix) TV.  The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you need, including pots, pans, spices, etc., so enjoy a nice meal.   Laundry located in building basement. All the amenities you will need, including: -Hair Dryer -Fresh clean linens and towels -Iron/ironing board -Coffee machine & french press -Everything you need to cook  -Toiletries   This is a three story building and the apartment is located on the third floor accessible by stairs (no elevator, unfortunately).

neighborhood_overview: Many small grocery stores nearby, and 10 minute walk to supermarket and Pharmacy.  There are also many great ethnic restaurants in the area, as well as two world famous Italian restaurants (Rino's and  Santarpio's Pizza). Given the proximity to Logan, at times planes can be heard taking off and landing, depending on the flight pattern though largely not noticable.   East Boston, nicknamed Eastie,  was long ago cattle land and was made up of five islands that were eventually connected into a single landmass around World War II.   It has long been a neighborhood of immigrants, first Irish and Canadian, followed by Russian Jews and Italians, then Southeast Asians, and, most recently, Central and South American.  You can see this diversity in the neighborhood’s many ethnic restaurants.
notes: NA
transit: The apartment is located just blocks from the Airport T Station and shuttle (NOTE - Airport T Station does not show up on the (Hidden by Airbnb) Map image): -4 minute walk to Blue Line Airport T station  -2 stops to the North End and New England Aquarium -3 stops to Downtown Boston, Quincy Market and short walk from there to Boston Common Like all of Boston, parking can be difficult so be cautious and read all the signs before you park. There is plenty of street parking available especially on weekends, so it shouldn't be a problem to find a spot.

name: East Boston - Private deck & perfect subway access
summary: Live / Stay In Boston, like a real Bostonian. Comfortable and cozy entire three bedroom flat with private deck on the third floor. Located 400 yds/metes from the subway system this is a great option to obtain the easy access to Boston you desire with the right value built in.  Or call an Uber for a short 5 minute drive into downtown.
space: While the entire third floor is yours to enjoy, there will be other people coming and going from the building.  Please respect the quiet hours and the comfort of others in the building.
description: Live / Stay In Boston, like a real Bostonian. Comfortable and cozy entire three bedroom flat with private deck on the third floor. Located 400 yds/metes from the subway system this is a great option to obtain the easy access to Boston you desire with the right value built in.  Or call an Uber for a short 5 minute drive into downtown. While the entire third floor is yours to enjoy, there will be other people coming and going from the building.  Please respect the quiet hours and the comfort of others in the building. Guests can access the common hallway to get to the flat.  The third floor is all yours to enjoy.  There is also laundry (washer & dryer) in the basement (free to use, and please supply your own detergent, available within a one block walk) To access simply use the back stairs. I try to meet all of my guests by stopping by during your stay, or if convenient being the one who checks you in.  Once you've arrived please don't hesitate to request a great location, event, restaur
neighborhood_overview: East Boston, or "Eastie" as it's called by locals, has experienced it's first few strong years of gentrification.  While the neighborhood has some character it's safely located across the street from a public school.  Eastie is changing fast, and for the better.  Come stay here now; try out and tell your friends about the mom and pop places you enjoyed in the neighborhood.
notes: This is my old flat.  I've used my furnishings to set up this Airbnb.  It's a great place to be based for a Boston trip, but some reviews I've received are based on an expectation of a 5-star hotel.  This Airbnb offers a great value with short travel times into the heart of the city, but it is not a luxury flat; true Airbnb'ers will love it! If you have question about the flat before or after you book please reach out and I will happily answer them. East Boston has a lot of character, and I encourage guests to explore the area around the flat as well as downtown Boston, which is less than 15 minutes away by subway and less than 5 minutes away by car.
transit: As Eastie may not be the reason you're visiting Boston, this location offers easy access to the more touristy neighborhoods of Boston. PARKING: Also the flat does not include a private driveway.  In the evening and weekends, or for two hour periods of time, you can park on the street.  Make sure to obey the posted signs.   For garage parking the closest lot I'm aware of is the economy airport parking lot.  It's about $18/day, and about a 10 minute walk (walk to and through the airport subway stop using the stairs) or short Uber/can ride from the flat. Cheers, Ross
access: Guests can access the common hallway to get to the flat.  The third floor is all yours to enjoy.  There is also laundry (washer & dryer) in the basement (free to use, and please supply your own detergent, available within a one block walk) To access simply use the back stairs.
interaction: I try to meet all of my guests by stopping by during your stay, or if convenient being the one who checks you in.  Once you've arrived please don't hesitate to request a great location, event, restaurant, etc. I live this city and this flat offers great access to multiple transportation options to access downtown.
house_rules: - Quiet hours start at 9:00 p.m. - There is a zero tolerance for smoking in the flat or on the deck.  Please kindly abstain from smoking while at the flat or a fine of your $200 deposit will be applied.  We never like to penalize, but the odor of smoke ruins the experience for the next guest. - From November - March do not set the heat above 69°.  This rule is to keep the cost of the unit economical for guests.  If you would like to set the heat higher this can be arranged with Ross for a nominal fee.  If this rule is broken after a reminder a fee from your deposit will be added to your bill.
host_about:
I'm a professional in Boston, and have recently been getting into real estate.  It's been a fun adventure, and I've enjoyed hosting with airbnb.  I love this city, and love that I can share it with people who stay at my places.  Be careful though, if you ask me what you should check out in Boston, it will take a lifetime to complete.

When I'm not talking up my city, you'll find me runing on the river, sailing on the ocean, or hosting another party on my deck with friends.

Best,

Ross
