name: Quaint 1 bedroom convenient to everything!!
summary: Top floor (3rd floor, stairs only) of a quiet traditional styled condo in a converted 19th century three-family house. Located in the heart of East Boston's Jefferies point neighborhood, the space is comfortable with easy access to all parts of the city and walking distance to the Airport. Surrounded by beautiful green space and parks just blocks away or enjoy a more private back yard on the premises with patio space available to the guests..
space: The space has been fully renovated with modern bath and kitchen while still maintaining a bit of it's historical charm. Super clean and well maintained with lots of amenities.
description: Top floor (3rd floor, stairs only) of a quiet traditional styled condo in a converted 19th century three-family house. Located in the heart of East Boston's Jefferies point neighborhood, the space is comfortable with easy access to all parts of the city and walking distance to the Airport. Surrounded by beautiful green space and parks just blocks away or enjoy a more private back yard on the premises with patio space available to the guests.. The space has been fully renovated with modern bath and kitchen while still maintaining a bit of it's historical charm. Super clean and well maintained with lots of amenities. Guest have access to the entire unit of except for private storage and basement. They can also use the shared backyard with its grill and smoker along with being free to sit out on the back deck for a morning coffee. We just ask that you be mindful and considerate of the other units residents that we share the back yard with. I'm a friendly guy and my friends say I should be
neighborhood_overview: Wow, what a unique and interesting neighborhood. Most homes have been renovated but still maintain much of the charm of a century old neighborhood. Many of the residents are from families who have lived there for many generations. East Boston has the most green space of any municipality in all of New England and the beauty of Boston Harbor and it's skyline is breathtaking. A clean and green city park is just blocks from the property as well as the harbor. Piers Park boasts walking paths, a outdoor gym, sailing center, and multiple bike rental locations. Maverick Square is a quick 1/2 mile walk where you will find ethnic food galore. Santarpio's New York style pizza, authentic Mexican food,  Maverick Marketplace Cafe, Americano Expresso Bar, and much more. Both Rino's Place and Italian Pizza Express (cash only) have gotten top ratings on the Food Channel's "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives". Or if you prefer waterfront dining try ReelHouse seafood or KO Pies at the shipyard. Walking distanc
notes: This is a third floor unit that only can be access by stairs.
transit: Planes, trains and automobiles abound to help you get around on your stay in Boston. Whether you would rather not get soft on vaca and rent a bike for you adventure or looking for a cheap way around town you have it all and more within walking distance. You have a convenient rental car center that can be used for that get away ride to the Cape or a shuttle that will take you to the multiple subway lines  for you to explore the city. Or choose to depend on old faithful and catch a bus to the subway line at the end of the my street.
access: Guest have access to the entire unit of except for private storage and basement. They can also use the shared backyard with its grill and smoker along with being free to sit out on the back deck for a morning coffee. We just ask that you be mindful and considerate of the other units residents that we share the back yard with.
interaction: I'm a friendly guy and my friends say I should be a tour guide since I know so much about the history of the city. I do live close to the property and will certainly answer your questions. But I do maintain a full time job.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Welcome y’all! My name is Gregory. I am 50 years old and originally from a small town Georgia. I came up to Boston 26 years ago to continue my education and enter the finance industry. I fell in love with Beantown and never left. Looking forward to sharing that love of the city, my place and all its hidden gems with you, your family, and friends. I might even sneak in a little southern hospitality if given the chance. Avid outdoors man that enjoys all that New England has to offer. From snowboarding at one of the easiest to get to mountains to fish for trophy blue fin out on the banks. Don’t be shy to ask about other interesting activities around the Boston.

name: 5min to Downtown & FiDi - Laundry in Building
summary: This is a classic multi-unit townhouse building located in the up-and-coming neighborhood of Maverick Square, East Boston. name: Up to 6 by Boston Harbor & Airport, 2min to Subway
summary: Live like a Bostonian at our 100-yr old, newly renovated apartment in the convenient neighborhood of East Boston.  This private apartment is clean & comfortable. We can accommodate up to 6 ppl.  The standard reservation is for one queen bedroom and a full-sized sofa bed in living room.  An additional bedroom w/queen bed can be unlocked IF you book for 6 ppl. Our house is just 1 stop to Airport and 2 stops to Downtown w/subway! You can even take a water taxi from the pier, a 2-min walk!
space: Full kitchen with coffee makers, dishes, pots & pans.  A cozy queen bedroom with a 46" internet TV.    Living room with full-sized sofa bed and 40" internet TV.    This private apartment is a 3rd floor walk-up.  ** Approx. 25 narrow stairs. ** Free street parking overnight (2-hr parking limit applies M-F 8am-6pm). Pay-to-park lots can be located nearby.

Entire private apartment. You choose either 1 bedroom or 2 bedroom based on your number of guests. A full-sized sofa bed is in the living room. Flexible
neighborhood_overview: East Boston was once a center for shipping and shipbuilding. It features one of the most beautiful waterfronts in the city! The waterfront is a gorgeous backdrop for pictures, and an interesting place to sit and relax. ***Hands down, this neighborhood offers the best view of Boston Harbor *** << Distances from Boston attractions: >> Aquarium     2.8 miles North End    2.4 miles TD Garden   2.4 miles Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall    2.6 miles Boston Common    2.9 miles Theater District    3 miles Fenway Park    5.4 miles Harvard University    6 miles
notes: PLEASE NOTE: The apartment is on the third floor. There are 2 flights of narrow stairs, around 25 steps. We do not have cable TV, only internet-based options.
transit: Whether you’d like to walk the Freedom Trail, catch a game at Fenway, a concert at TD Garden, visit Boston's amazing museums and colleges, or shop and dine on the town, our apartment is close to everything.  Check out these transportation options:   > By subway train: Better known as the "T" in Boston        Maverick Blue Line station is a 3-min walk from our door. We are  just 1 stop away       from Logan International Airport (3 mins) and 2 stops (7 mins) from downtown.     > By taxi:       Our apartment is 6 minutes from Logan International Airport.        You can call a taxi or ride-share to all the attractions only a few miles.      > By car:       If you are driving, East Boston has nearby pay-for-parking lots and various street        parking opportunities  - be sure to read the posted signs!    > On foot:       Stroll along the waterfront Piers Park, visit ICA Boston, taste Downeast cider, and try        many diverse South American and ethnic cuisines (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: Entire private apartment. You choose either 1 bedroom or 2 bedroom based on your number of guests. A full-sized sofa bed is in the living room.
interaction: Flexible self check-in with keypad locks. Let us know what time you are arriving and if you need any assistance. We can accommodate most special requests. Just send us a message. We live right downstairs.
house_rules: - Standard booking is for 4 people. Additional room can be booked for 2 more people.

host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: Boston Airport Subway ★ we're a licensed 5* Airbnb
summary: Welcome! We are licensed and permitted Airbnb in Boston. This ensures a safe, reliable Airbnb experience for all our guests, meeting all safety and inspectional standards. If you are in Boston for a vacation, business or just a short layover, you've found the perfect place to call your base.  • Modern, tastefully decorated, ultra-clean with a ton of sunlight • Nearby subway will take you into the heart of Boston in 1 stop! • Easy access to airport - catch that early flight!
space: Enjoy your own private room in a newly renovated, gorgeous modern apartment with a ton of sunlight. The room is spacious and cute, it has a walk-in closet and a marble shower! WE PROVIDE: -Fresh Towels and Linens -Your own set of keys -Q Tips & Cotton Swabs -Iron -Hair Blow Dryer -Shampoo, Conditioner & Body Wash -Hand soap, hand lotion -Face wash, face toner & face moisturizer -Tampons/Pads EXPERIENCE: We get a lot of travelers from all over the world coming to visit Boston for various reasons. It's a funky, artsy & hip apartment that attracts like-minded people. ALL are welcome! If you prefer to keep to yourself or are busy with your plans, no worries! This is YOUR vacation. Whether that's sitting on our velvet couch in the living room or hanging in your room for privacy. Some guests we don't see during the entirety of their stay! neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: - LUGGAGE - Flying into to Boston early in the morning or leaving late in the evening? As a courtesy, you can drop off your luggage in our common area before you check-in or leave it there until the evening after check-out. This way, you can enjoy the city without having to worry about luggage. Please note that it will be in the public view and we're not liable for it, however. - CHECK-IN - You're welcome to drop-off your luggage anytime. However, the suite may not be ready for check-in until 6pm the day of arrival. - CHECK-OUT - Guests must check-out by 12pm on the departure day established in their reservation. However, feel free to leave your luggage in the common area to pick-up later that day. - EXTRA GUESTS - Please inform us if you would like to have additional guests stay who were not on the original reservation (a $60 charge would apply). We are flexible and try to accommodate special requests and provide assistance whenever possible. We are a friendly couple that run a clean,
transit: Downtown Boston (5 minutes T ride) Boston Logan Airport (10 minutes walk) Local Beach (5 minutes T ride)
access: Fast Wi-Fi available, so you can catch up with friends or on work at any time. Private bathroom is available in the apartment. Private walk-in closet. De'Longhi coffee machine with unlimited gourmet coffee. Complimentary tea selection is also available. Great way to start your morning! Comfortable living room area with games and books for your enjoyment. Relax on the couch after a day of exploring the city. Everything is brand-new, modern and very comfortable.
interaction: Most of the times, you won't see us at the space due to other commitments. We offer self check-in and self check-out for your convenience. However, we're both just a phone call away and are always happy to help, offer advice, or assist with whatever will make your stay more comfortable. Please don't hesitate to reach out at any time!
house_rules: Please no shoes in the apartment, no drinking or partying in the apartment (enjoy the city nightlife!). Absolutely no bringing other people/friends (who are not apart of booking) to the apartment... Not even to "hangout for a little". Again, please respect our home and don't show up with a stranger on our doorstep. Please do not give out our address or have friends meet you at the loft. I mean, common sense right? How would you like it? CHECK IN: Please let us know the time you'd like to check in BEFORE you check-in.  QUIET HOURS: We want to be respectful of everyone's sleeping schedule. We ask to be considerate of noise between 11pm-9am. But no curfew, you can come and go whatever time you want! But seriously, please don't be giggling and talking loud when you come in late or slamming doors at 7am. We all need sleeeeep :) CAT: We have an indoor only cat living in our property - we ask to be respectful to our cat. Be mindful when you leaving our home and do not let the cat run out. LAU

name: Comfortable Stay | Close to Airport + Downtown
summary: Located a short walk from the airport and 3 train stops to downtown Boston,  this newly renovated bedroom features a queen size bed, plenty of space for luggage and clothes, & a private work space. The air conditioning and heating unit offers a comfortable and pleasant night's sleep. Spacious kitchen and dining area, as well as a charming backyard welcome you to rest. We will be happy to helping with recommendations in local restaurants, transportation options, and best places to visit!
space: This comfortable room features a comfortable queen size bed with two pillows, a soft and cozy duvet, convenient outlets located on either side of the bed, a large workspace, hanging space, shelf space, luggage hold and extra blankets available upon request.  This bedroom is equipped with a multi functional air conditioning, fan and heating unit for comfortable and quiet temperature control!  Instructions on the use of the air conditioning/heating unit will be provided upon confirmation of booking.  Just outside of the room, you will find a common hall shared between other two rooms rented out, where you will find a Keurig, common amenities and a Boston recommendation guide!  Please be aware that this is a private bedroom in a shared home. The other two bedrooms in the second floor are also rented out on Airbnb, and the master bathroom will be shared between the guests. The kitchen and living area are open for use, and if there are any questions on amenities, please ask!

neighborhood_overview: We are located in the historical Eagle Hill neighborhood located steps away from Day Square, a 10 minute walk from Airport MBTA station and a 30 minute commute to heart of downtown Boston. East Boston greenway is located close by with a trail leading directly to the Boston Harbor waterfront. Constitutional Beach is a trailed 20 minute walk away. Plenty of popular restaurants nearby: Santarpio's Pizza, Rino's Place, and Downeast Cider House.
notes: During the summer, we have our small and quiet dog Nala (beagle) with us.  Please, contact us if  you are allergic to dogs, so we will make sure that she stays in the basement studio during your stay.
transit: We are conveniently located directly between two stops on the Blue Line MBTA. We are a 7 minute walk away from Wood Island T stop and a 10-12 minute walk away from Airport T stop.
access: There is a lockbox assigned to each room at the front door. Upon confirmation of reservation, we will provide you with a lockbox code, and the name of your room. Check in and check out will be self-done for your convenience. If this listing is unavailable and you would like to take a look at our other listings, follow the link below: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/35236258?source_impression_id=p3_1560890965_%2BAFmxTJww2oSimAD https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/35420961?source_impression_id=p3_1560890997_6OvIh6qNgh0k8ECw
interaction: We are openly available to our guests as we are currently living in the basement studio. We love meeting new people and giving recommendations for general questions regarding Boston! We would love to chat over a cup of coffee with you during your stay.

We will be happy to helping with recommendations in local restaurants, transportation options, and best places to visit! This cozy room features a comfortable twin size bed with two pillows, a soft and cozy duvet, convenient outlets located on either side of the bed, shelf with a desk lamp to be conveniently used as a nightstand and extra blankets available upon request.  This bedroom is equipped with a multi functional air conditioning, fan and heating unit for comfortable and quiet temperature control!  Instructions on the use of the air conditioning/heating unit will be provided upon confirmation of booking.
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the historical Eagle Hill neighborhood located steps away from Day Square, a 10 minute walk from Airport MBTA station and a 30 minute commute to heart of downtown Boston. East Boston greenway is located close by with a trail leading directly to the Boston Harbor waterfront. Constitutional Beach is a trailed 20 minute walk away. Plenty of popular restaurants nearby: Santarpio's Pizza, Rino's Place, and Downeast Cider House.
notes: Please let us know if you are allergic to dogs. Our small and quiet dog Nala stays with us in the basement studio, so we want to make sure she doesn't intervene with your comfort.
transit: We are conveniently located directly between two stops on the Blue Line MBTA. We are a 7 minute walk away from Wood Island T stop and a 10-12 minute walk away from Airport T stop.
access: There is a lockbox assigned to each room at the front door. Upon confirmation of reservation, we will provide you with a lockbox code, and the name of your room. Check in and check out will be self-done for your convenience. If this listing is unavailable and you would like to take a look at our other listings, follow the links below:  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/35196645?source_impression_id=p3_1560890519_nukJowNPrQvHfyqI https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/35236258?source_impression_id=p3_1560890965_%2BAFmxTJww2oSimAD
interaction: We are openly available to our guests as we are currently living in the basement. We love meeting new people and giving recommendations for general questions regarding Boston! We would love to chat over a cup of coffee with you during your stay.

name: East Boston Hidden Gem: 5 min to dwntwn & airport
summary: If you are in Boston for vacation, business, or just passing through on a layover, look no further! Our home is located steps from the MBTA Blue Line, just one stop from downtown Boston. Get to the North End, Quincy Market, Freedom Trail and many other historic destinations in less than 10 minutes! Logan airport is located just over a mile away and is easily accessible by ride sharing or public transit. Have the city of Boston at your fingertips during your stay at Maverick Street R&R!
space: Our home sits on the first two floors in a 4-story house in the heart of Maverick Square. You will stay on the top level, with a private bathroom, shared access to the kitchen and dining, and access to our smart TV with an Amazon Firestick. Read reviews from our other East Boston listing: "This place was super cute and very clean. Steps away from the train station and very simple to get to the airport or downtown Boston." "this place is amazing, 10/10. We were basic tourists and did the basic things. Harvard, freedom trail, Sam Adams, whale watching, etc.. and the location was perfect, not more then a $15 Uber ride anywhere. And 6$ to the airport. it’s also really close to the bus/train station which is even cheaper." "Very close to airport and the T! Jason and Kirk were quick to respond and very accommodating . They allowed us to leave our baggage before check in and after, which was a huge help since we had early and late flights :)"

Our home sits on the first two floors in a 4-story house in the heart of Maverick Square. You will stay on the top level, with a private bathroom, shared access to the kitchen and dining, and access to our smart TV with an Amazon Firestick. Read reviews from our other East Boston listing: "This place was super cute and very clean. Steps away from the train station and very simple to get to the airport or downtown Boston." "this place is amazing, 10/10. We were basic tourists and did the basic things. Har
neighborhood_overview: East Boston is a vibrant neighborhood with many local bars/restaurants, beautiful views of the city, and quick access to downtown. Our place is walking distance to both Piers and LoPresti Parks and plenty of delicious food options.
notes: Parking at our place is all street parking. It is free, but be sure to read signs where you park. We suggest looking for a spot on Paris Street - it is closest to our place and does not require a resident sticker to park.
transit: The easiest way to get around will be by subway. The T is a ~2 minute walk from our house and will take you all over the city. Street parking is available on our street and the surrounding area, but be sure to read the signs!

name: Cozy one bedroom close to it all!
summary: Our home is your home - simple, cozy, with a few touches of luxury in a great location and the best value in Boston proper. Short walk to international award winning Piers Park (2 minutes) and Sailing Center and to the Maverick subway station (5 minutes). Jeffries Point is one of Boston's safest neighborhoods only one subway stop to the airport or to the financial district (or take the water taxi as we are a 3 minute walk from Boston Harbor).  Everything is nearby
space: This is a small one bedroom apartment in Jeffries Point.  It is our home we will allow others to use while we are out of town, so it will be clean and have everything you may need.  Condo was completely renovated 2 years ago.  Almost across the street from TripAdvisor's #1 (or #2) restaurant in all of Metro Boston (a relative hole in the wall): Italian Express.   The apartment will usually be stocked with food you are welcome to use so long as it replaced or compensated for with a small restocking fee. There is a laundromat a few doors down or, if you need only a small amount of laundry (or stay for an extended period) we can make a compact washer available for use, upon request.  The living room is a cool layout with very high ceilings, a loft space, a futon couch, two massage chairs (one zero gravity).  We pushed it to fit in the two large massage chairs with everything else, so if you want to pull out and use the futon you may have to move the chairs a little (on magic movers but wi

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very unique: Jeffries Point is a peninsula with only one way in and is almost all residential, however one of Boston's top-rated Italian restaurants is almost across the street (Italian Express), the new gastropub "The Quiet Few" is less than one minute walk, as are many convenience shops, bakeries, and ethnic restaurants.  A family Italian bread bakery makes fresh bread daily starting at 5 AM almost across the street every day except Sunday.  If you come often it is convenient to learn how to walk here from the airport car rental terminal (about ten minutes walk from free Airport shuttle to the car rental counters) - so when you land at the airport, you are "home"!  The skyline views from Piers Park are the best in Boston. Nearby Maverick subway is only one stop from the heart of downtown Boston and one stop from the airport.   Other nearby restaurants include Cunard Tavern, Maverick Marketplace Cafe, and The Reel House (with amazing views).  About 1 mile away are
notes: You will love the area.  Perfect blend of peaceful neighborhood with proximity to everything the city offers.
transit: Very close to MBTA "T" (Blue line), Maverick (and Airport) Station.  City bicycle rental kiosks are also available nearby.  If you want an occasional car then the airport rental center is about a ten minute walk or take Uber or call Enterprise.  The best way to get around here is walking and the subway.
access: Entire condo/apartment are yours and yours only
interaction: We own the building and our tenants will be on the 2nd and third floors.  The neighborhood is very friendly with neighbors on the streets generally happy to introduce others to our beloved little neighborhood. We will be available by phone most of the time and we will have others available in the unlikely instance something were to come up. If we are in town we will greet you personally We are just far enough down Jeffries Point  penninsula (as close to a cul de sac as you will find in the city - there is only one way in and out and no through traffic) for being relatively quiet while in the city, yet still very close to the subway, shops, parks, restaurants, cider brewery, art museum, etc.
house_rules: Understand this is our personal home and it will be a very nice place to stay, though we don't aim for complete perfection (i.e. everything will be great but if you go on a hint you may could find an aberrant dust bunny - just want to set reasonable expectations!).  We leave the home FULLY STOCKED with everything you could possibly need, INCLUDING FOOD - please replace what you use or agree to compensate Boston prices (high) and a small fee if you can't replace everything.  "Vine and Barley" local wine, beer, and liquor store less than 2 minute walk from here as are several other convenience stores.  Shaw's Supermarket 1 mile/10-15 minutes walk if you need a lot of things - or if you stay more than a week and want to eat a lot in-house then I will tell you how to easily get to Market Basket (much cheaper) or Whole Foods, Chinatown, and/or Trader Joe's.  Thank you and enjoy your home in Boston!
host_about: Professional speaking English natively.  Can communicate in Spanish, French, and Mandarin Chinese.

name: ★ Private Room close to Airport, Great Location ★
summary: Welcome! Private room with a queen size bed, walking distance to the Airport and just 2 stops on the Metro to Downtown.  PLEASE NOTE: • Set of stairs leading to house and room • One shared bathroom and a half bath • Poor noise isolation in room • Self check-in and self check-out for your convenience via a smart lock • 6 minute walk to the blue line subway • Easy access to the I90 & I93 Highway • Restaurants, bars, Shaw's (groceries), 24/7 CVS and Walgreens within 5 min walking distance
space: Simple gorgeous modern house with a great open layout. This room is in the basement and requires you to go down a flight of stairs. Please note that you're renting a single private bedroom within a larger house. There are several private bedrooms in the house - most of which are used by other Airbnb guests, so you'll be in good company. The living room provides a great place to relax after a day of exploring the area, connect with other guests that may be staying at the same time, watch a bit of American TV or just read a book on the couch. Our kitchen is available to all of our guests with complimentary coffee and tea. There is a Shaw's supermarket just 5 min walking where you can purchase groceries and use the kitchen to prepare a breakfast or lunch before you head out the door. There are 1.5 bathrooms in the house and you can use either one, as you prefer. If this is your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay: www.airbnb.com/r/ijm

host_about: I am from Boston, and love to travel and meet new people and learn about new cultures.  I would describe myself as very easy going and open minded.
